Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Soybean toxin 27 kDa chain (SBTX 27 kDa chain; Plant defensin)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Involved in plant defense. Has antifungal activity against C. sojina but not A. niger and F. solani. Does not have urease or hemagglutination activities. Does not inhibit trypsin. Injection into mice produces toxic effects such as dyspnea, tonic-clonic convulsion and death.
Sequence Information.PTM: Subunit structure Heterodimer of a 27 kDa subunit and a 17 kDa subunit; disulfide-linked. SBTX is known to be glycosylated but it is not known which one of its two subunits is modified; contains 5% carbohydrates.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed in seeds, leaves, roots and stem (at protein level).
Sequence Information.Toxic Dose: LD50 is 5.6 mg/kg by intraperitoneal injection into mice.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: On the 2D-gel the determined pI of SBTX is
Sequence Information.Biophysicochemical properties: pH dependence (Activity decreases below pH 5.5 and above pH 8.0).

Literature.Title: SBTX, a new toxic protein distinct from soyatoxin and other toxic soybean [Glycine max] proteins, and its inhibitory effect on Cercospora sojina growth.
Literature.Author: Vasconcelos IM, Morais JK, Siebra EA, Carlini CR, Sousa DO, Beltramini LM, Melo VM, Oliveira JT.
